intro: Eriosema congestum, commonly known as the clustered eriosema, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets that are hairy on the underside. Eriosema congestum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
